meanings.definition: To lower in rank or estimation.
meanings.sent1: She disrates her own abilities, always doubting herself.
meanings.sent2: The teacher disrates students who do not complete their assignments.
meanings.sent3: The cat disrates the new toy, preferring the old one instead.
meanings.sent4: His careless behavior disrates his reputation among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The storm disrates the once majestic tree, leaving it broken and bent.

meanings.definition: To reduce in value or worth.
meanings.sent1: The scratches on the car disrate its resale value.
meanings.sent2: Economic instability can disrate the currency of a country.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally disrates the dish by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: Lack of maintenance can disrate the condition of a house over time.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism disrates the artist's work, causing them to doubt their talent.
